sen.j: 藤原 詮子（ふじわら の せんし/あきこ、応和2年（962年） - 長保3年閏12月22日 (旧暦)（1002年2月7日）は、平安時代、第64代円融天皇女御。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Senshi (Akiko) (962- February 7, 1002) is the nyogo of the 64th emperor, Emperor Enyu in Heian Period.

FUJIWARA no Senshi (her given name can also be pronounced "Akiko") (962 - February 7, 1002) was the nyogo (a court title given to a consort of the Emperor) of the sixty-forth emperor, Emperor Enyu, in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: Explanation of Japanese term (please check whether I have correctly understood the term "nyogo), grammar
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Senshi (her given name can also be pronounced "Akiko") (962 - February 7, 1002) was the nyogo (a court title given to a consort of the Emperor) of the sixty-forth emperor, Emperor Enyu, in the Heian period.

sen.j: 第66代一条天皇生母（国母）。
sen.e: She is the mother (Kokumo (emperor's mother)) of the 66th emperor, Emperor Ichijo.
She was the mother of the 66th emperor, Emperor Ichijo (she also held the title Kokumo, meaning empress dowager).
sen.cmt: 時制「国母」の意味をより具体的に補いました。
sen.e: She was the mother of the 66th emperor, Emperor Ichijo (she also held the title Kokumo, meaning empress dowager).

sen.j: 東三条院は女院である。
sen.e: "Tosanjoin" is a type of nyoin (the title given to the imperial empress or crown princess after becoming a Buddhist priest).
sen.cmt: 女院→nyoin (the title given to the imperial empress or crown princess after becoming a Buddhist priest) [http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn/148719/m0u/女院/]
sen.e: She took the title Tosanjoin upon becoming nyoin (or retired empress)
She took the title Tosanjoin upon becoming nyoin (or retired empress).

sen.j: 摂政関白・太政大臣藤原兼家の次女で、母は摂津守藤原中正の女子時姫。
sen.e: She is the second daughter of Regent (sessho) Kanpaku Chancellor of the State FUJIWARA no Kaneie, and her mother is Tokihime, the daughter of Settsu no kami FUJIWARA no Nakamasa.
She was the second daughter of FUJIWARA no Kaneie, who held the titles Sessho, Kanpaku, and Chancellor of State, and Tokihime, the daughter of FUJIWARA no Nakamasa, who held the title Settsu no kami.
sen.cmt: Just lining up a series of titles such as "Regent (sessho) Kanpaku Chancellor of the State" before the person's name does not really work in English. Also, using a title such as "Settsu no kami" before a person's name without any explanation may result in the reader thinking the whole thing is the person's name.
sen.e: She was the second daughter of FUJIWARA no Kaneie, who held the titles Sessho, Kanpaku, and Chancellor of State, and Tokihime, the daughter of FUJIWARA no Nakamasa, who held the title Settsu no kami.

sen.j: 先後して摂関に在職した藤原道隆・藤原道兼・藤原道長、また冷泉天皇女御藤原超子は同母の兄弟。
sen.e: Her maternal siblings were FUJIWARA no Michitaka, FUJIWARA no Michikane, and FUJIWARA no Michinaga who became sessho in such sequence, and the daughter of Emperor Reizei, Nyogo Fujiwara no Choshi (Toko).

Her maternal siblings were FUJIWARA no Michitaka, FUJIWARA no Michikane, and FUJIWARA no Michinaga who became Sessho in that order, and the wife of Emperor Reizei, Nyogo Fujiwara no Choshi (also pronounced as "Toko").

sen.j: 天元 (日本)元年（978年）8月に入内し、同年11月4日_(旧暦)に女御の宣旨を被る。
sen.e: She married and entered the imperial court in August 978 and was presented by the emperor to become Nyogo on November 4 (old lunar calendar) of the same year.
She married and entered the imperial court in August 978 and was named Nyogo on November 4 (by the old lunar calendar) of the same year.
sen.cmt: and was presented by the emperor to'→'and was named'
sen.e: She married and entered the imperial court in August 978 and was named Nyogo on November 4 (by the old lunar calendar) of the same year.

sen.j: 同3年（980年）従四位下に叙せられる。
sen.e: She was given the rank of Ju shi-i no ge in 980.
She was given the rank of Ju shi-i no ge (lower fourth court rank) in 980.
sen.cmt: Added explanation of ju shi-I noge
sen.e: She was given the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in 980.

sen.j: この年の6月1日_(旧暦)に兼家の東三条殿において第一皇子懐仁親王（のちの一条天皇）を生む。
sen.e: On June 1 (old lunar calendar) of the same year, she gave birth to the first crown prince, Prince Kanehito (eventually Emperor Ichijo) at Kaneie's Higashi-Sanjo-dono.
On June 1 (by the old lunar calendar) of the same year, she gave birth to the first crown prince, Prince Kanehito (later Emperor Ichijo) at Kaneie's Higashi-Sanjo-dono palace.
On June 1 (by the old lunar calendar) of the same year, she gave birth to the first crown prince, Imperial Prince Kanehito (later Emperor Ichijo) at Kaneie's Higashi Sanjo dono palace.
sen.cmt: Higashi-Sanjo-dono→Higashi Sanjo donoImperialを追加しました。

sen.j: ところが円融天皇の一粒種を生みながら、関白藤原頼忠の女藤原遵子に后の座を奪われたことで、父兼家と共に天皇を恨んで里邸の東三条邸にこもり、天皇のたびたびの召還にも応じなかった。
sen.e: However, the empress seat was taken away from her by Kanpaku FUJIWARA no Yoritada's daughter, FUJIWARA no Junshi (Nobuko) despite the fact that Senshi gave birth to the only child of the Emperor Enyu, and she secluded herself in her parental home of Higashi-Sanjo-dono due to a grudge against both her father Kaneie and the emperor that she did not response to his summoning.

However, she was replaced as empress by Kanpaku FUJIWARA no Yoritada's daughter, FUJIWARA no Junshi (Nobuko), despite the fact that Senshi had given birth to Emperor Enyu's only child, and she secluded herself in her parental home of Higashi-Sanjo-dono, both she and her father hating the Emperor and refusing to respond to his summons.

However, she was replaced as empress by Kanpaku FUJIWARA no Yoritada's daughter, FUJIWARA no Junshi (Nobuko), despite the fact that Senshi had given birth to Emperor Enyu's only child, and she secluded herself in her parental home of Higashi Sanjo dono, both she and her father hating the Emperor and refusing to respond to his summons.

sen.j: また遵子立后の際、遵子の兄弟藤原公任は東三条邸の前で自慢げに「この女御は、いつか后にはたちたまふらむ（こちらの女御はいつ立后なさるのか）」と言ったため、兼家・詮子親子の恨みを買ったという。
sen.e: In addition, when Junshi became the empress, Junshi's brother FUJIWARA no Kinto boasted in front of Higashi-Sanjo-dono and said, 'when will this Nyogo promoted to be an empress?' that brought hatred from Kaneie and his daughter, Senshi.

In addition, when Junshi became the empress, Junshi's brother FUJIWARA no Kinto had stood in front of Higashi-Sanjo-dono, bragging 'when will this nyogo become empress?' and earning the hatred of Kaneie and his daughter, Senshi.
sen.cmt: boasted in front of Higashi-Sanjo-dono and said'→'had stood in front of Higashi-Sanjo-dono, bragging''that brought hatred from'→'and earning the hatred of'
sen.e: In addition, when Junshi became empress, Junshi's brother FUJIWARA no Kinto had stood in front of Higashi Sanjo dono, braggingly asking 'when will this nyogo become empress?' and earning the hatred of Kaneie and his daughter, Senshi.
sen.cmt: 表現スタイル。“became the empress,”=>”became empress,” “brag” を質問に使うのが不自然。 =>” braggingly asking 'when will this nyogo become empress?'

sen.j: しかし、所生の一条天皇が即位すると形勢は一変し、寛和2年（986年）7月5日_(旧暦)に皇太后に冊立される。
sen.e: However, when her Emperor Ichijo came into power, situation drastically changed and she was promoted to be the Empress Dowager on July 5, 986 (old lunar calendar).
However, when Emperor Ichijo came into power, the situation drastically changed and she was made Empress Dowager on July 5, 986 (old lunar calendar).
However, when Emperor Ichijo came into power, the situation drastically changed and she was made Empress Dowager on July 5, 986 (old lunar calendar).

sen.j: 正暦2年（991年）2月、円融法皇が崩御したが、詮子は同年9月16日_(旧暦)に出家して、皇太后宮職を停めて院号宣下を受け、居宅の東三条邸に因んで東三条院を称した。
sen.e: When the Cloistered Emperor Enyu (who became a monk) passed away in February 991, she retired as the Empress Dowager and received the title of Tosanjoin taken after the name of her residence, Higashi-Sanjo-dono.

When the Cloistered Emperor Enyu (who had become a monk) passed away in February 991, she retired as the Empress Dowager and took the title of Tosanjoin, after the name of her residence, Higashi-Sanjo-dono.

When the Cloistered Emperor Enyu (who had become a monk) passed away in February 991, she retired as the Empress Dowager on September 16 (old lunar calendar) of the same year and took the title of Tosanjoin, after the name of her residence, Higashi Sanjo dono.
sen.cmt: Higashi-Sanjo-dono→Higashi Sanjo donoon September 16 (old lunar calendar) of the same year補足

sen.j: これが女院号の嚆矢である。
sen.e: This was the start of the Nyoin Go (the title of Nyoin).
She was the first person to use a nyoin title.
She was the first person to use a nyoin title.

sen.j: 一条朝にあって国母として強い発言権をもち、しばしば政治に介入したため、藤原実資の日記『小右記』には「国母専朝」と非難された。
sen.e: Since she had a strong say in the court of Ichijo as Kokumo and interfered occasionally with politics, she was accused as 'Kokumo who does only morning services' in FUJIWARA no Sanesuke's diary, "Ouki."
sen.cmt: 国母専朝→Kokumo who does only morning services と判断しました[定訳不明]
sen.e: Since she had a strong say in the court of Ichijo as Kokumo and often interfered in politics, leading FUJIWARA no Sanesuke to criticise her in his diary "Ouki," saying 'the Kokumo rules the court.'
She had a strong say in the court of Ichijo as Kokumo and often interfered in politics, leading FUJIWARA no Sanesuke to criticize her in his diary "Ouki," saying 'the Kokumo rules the court.'

sen.j: また、4歳年下の弟・道長を可愛がって兄道隆・同道兼没後の執政者に彼を推して、甥藤原伊周を圧迫し、ついに兄一家を没落に追い込んだのは著名な話である。
sen.e: In addition, there is a well known story that she used to favor four years younger brother, Michinaga, and when her younger brother Michitaka and Michikane passed away, she appointed him as the administrator, suppressed the nephew, FUJIWARA no Korechika, and caused the fall of her older brother's family.

In addition, there is a well known story that she used to favor her brother, Michinaga, who was four years younger, and when her older brothers, Michitaka and Michikane, passed away, she pushed for him to be appointed administrator over her nephew, FUJIWARA no Korechika, and later caused the downfall of her older brother's family.
sen.cmt: Moved 'who was four years younger''appointed him...the nephew'→'pushed for him to be appointed administrator over her nephew'

sen.j: その反面、厚い信仰心をもち、真正極楽寺・慈徳寺を建立した。
sen.e: On the other hand, she had a strong religious faith and established Shinsho Gokuraku-ji and Jitoku-ji Temples.
On the other hand, she was deeply religious and established Shinsho Gokuraku-ji and Jitoku-ji Temples.

sen.j: また失脚した源高明の末娘源明子を引き取って道長に娶わせたといわれ、一条皇后藤原定子が難産で崩御した際も、残された第二皇女び子内親王（び＝女偏に美）を養女とした。
sen.e: Furthermore, she took in MINAMOTO no Akiko, the youngest daughter of the overthrown MINAMOTO no Takaakira to marry her to Michinaga and adopted the second crown princess, Princess Bishi when Ichijo's Empress FUJIWARA no Teishi (Sadako) died of a difficult labor.

sen.e: Furthermore, she took in MINAMOTO no Akiko, the youngest daughter of the overthrown MINAMOTO no Takaakira, having her marry Michinaga and adopted the second crown princess, Imperial Princess Bishi, when Ichijo's Empress FUJIWARA no Teishi (Sadako) died during a difficult labor.

sen.j: 長保3年閏12月、院別当の藤原行成の屋敷にて崩御し、宇治木幡の藤原一族の墓所のうち、宇治陵に葬られた。
sen.e: She died in February 1002 at the palace of FUJIWARA no Yukinari, apart from the imperial court, and was buried in Uji no Misasaki among the graves of FUJIWARA clan of Uji Kowata.
She died in February 1002 at the palace of FUJIWARA no Yukinari, away from the imperial court, and was buried in Uji no Misasaki among the graves of the FUJIWARA clan of Uji Kowata.
She died in December 1002 at the palace of FUJIWARA no Yukinari, away from the imperial court, and was buried in Uji no Misasaki among the graves of the FUJIWARA clan of Uji Kowata.

sen.j: なお、『大鏡』及び『栄花物語』には葬儀の際に道長が遺骨を抱持する場面が描かれているがこれは創作であり、史実において骨を抱持したのは詮子の甥藤原兼隆（道兼の子）である。
sen.e: There is an illustrated scenery of Michinaga cradling her ashes during the funeral in "Okagami" and "Eiga Monogatari," but they are just fiction and Senshi's nephew (Michikane's son), FUJIWARA no Kanetaka, was the one who cradled her bones in reality.
